episodes.title: Leah Remini: The Jehovah’s Witnesses - A&E Special
episodes.description:
#leahremini #exjw #jehovahswitnesses

First off, thank you to Leah Remini for doing this documentary.  And big thanks and hugs to all the ex-JW’s that were on the A&E Special, and for openly sharing their experiences and stories. 

In this video, I share my thoughts about the show, triggers, and other stuff that came up. Regardless of how long you’ve been out of the JW Organization, (ExJW; DF’d; or just have JW family), there will be things from this Special that will stir up emotions, on various levels. 
Be mindful of this, and take care of yourselves. x

For people that are considering joining, leaving, or studying with Jehovah's Witnesses, please watch the A&E program. It is an honest look at real-life experiences of what happens in this Organization. 

———————
If you missed the A&E special that aired last night, (Nov 13/18), "Leah Remini - The Jehovah's Witnesses"... and don't have access to A&E, or have a cable service provider that let’s you stream it, here's a workaround I found…

Download the A&E app on your phone. 
Sign up with a new account, and you’ll get 3 credits to watch 3 programs, one of which you can choose this Special. 
Hope that works for any of you that are looking for it! 
:)  

UPDATE: Here's a link that was shared with me for those that are able to view it... https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x6x5upe
-------------------

About sharing stories and experiences - 

I love this quote by Iyanla Vanzant: 
"It's important that we share our experiences with others. Your story will heal you and your story will heal somebody else. When you tell your story, you free yourself and give other people permission to acknowledge their own story." 

--------------------

PLEASE NOTE: If you are only here to troll, preach, or be disrepectful, your comments will be deleted. 

This channel is meant to be a positive, respectful and welcoming space/community for people that are going through similar experiences from their association of the JW.Org . Especially those of you that have been disfellowshipped or shunned from your friends and family, know that you aren't alone. Thanks for being here.  :)
